body:
Re schemes:  for analysis, what are all the types and enum choices for each
field. It’s a kindness to the analyst.

On Thu, Nov 30, 2017 at 11:36 AM Mike Cooper <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> Thanks for looking over this everyone. I'm going to start implementing
> this today.
>
> Just one note that the "extra" field should be key/value even when
> recording.
>
> Thanks for clarifying this. This is my intent. I am using a ES6-shorthand
> for object construction, in which { x, y } is equivalent to { x: x, y: y }
> .
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/mozilla/normandy/issues/1139#issuecomment-348262990>,
> or mute the thread
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAKAj7jh4YPlG957xNbJosijWjTS9xKPks5s7uemgaJpZM4Qip7z>
> .
>

Re schemes:  for analysis, what are all the types and enum choices for each
field. It’s a kindness to the analyst.
…
On Thu, Nov 30, 2017 at 11:36 AM Mike Cooper ***@***.***> wrote:
 Thanks for looking over this everyone. I'm going to start implementing
 this today.

 Just one note that the "extra" field should be key/value even when
 recording.

 Thanks for clarifying this. This is my intent. I am using a ES6-shorthand
 for object construction, in which { x, y } is equivalent to { x: x, y: y }
 .

body_html:
Re schemes: for analysis, what are all the types and enum choices for each field. It’s a kindness to the analyst.
…
On Thu, Nov 30, 2017 at 11:36 AM Mike Cooper ***@***.***> wrote: Thanks for looking over this everyone. I'm going to start implementing this today. Just one note that the "extra" field should be key/value even when recording. Thanks for clarifying this. This is my intent. I am using a ES6-shorthand for object construction, in which { x, y } is equivalent to { x: x, y: y } . — You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
